Uses of Package
ShadowQuest

  • Classes in ShadowQuest used by ShadowQuest 
    Class and Description
    Camera
    Represents the camera that controls our viewpoint.
    GameObject
    A very broad super class encompassing all classes except camera All GameObjects have a position and are renderable, and hence have images associated with them.
    Inventory
    Stores all the items currently held by the player, as well as some data about them, e.g.
    Item
    Abstract item class for handling item objects.
    Monster
    Class providing methods to enable monster interaction.
    Player
    Represents a single player character The player can be controlled by the user and can perform a number of actions: - Move: 2D movement - Attack: Deal damage to all enemies within range - Interact: Interact with all villagers within range - Pickup: Pickup all items within range
    Position
    Represents a single point in 2D space
    Stats
    Base stats of a unit, they include: - MaxHP: the maximum health the unit has - CoolDown: the minimum time interval between two attacks - Damage: the maximum amount of damage one attack can deal - Speed: the number of pixels the unit can move per update
    Unit
    Units in general represent humans in the game world Most units can move, and all units interact with the player in some way.
    Villager
    Villagers are friendly units who help the player.
    World
    Represents the entire game world.
